5.heading: Dave.

6.heading: Dave.
6.title: "No Problem. I Moved My Gall Bladder to 4:30"
6.author: by Bill Holbrook
6.appears_in: reproduced on p. 159 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Mom is alarmed to learn that Dave and Samantha are playing doctor, and relieved that that means a round of golf.

8.title: Dave
8.author: David Miller.
8.series: Nov. 20, 1992) "Some Volunteer for the Legalize Marijuana Now Campaign"*
notes: Summary: A telephone solicitor calls and forgets why.

9.title: Dave
9.author: by David Miller.
notes: Summary: Dave can remember the words to the Brady Bunch theme song, but can't get started on the preamble to the U.S. Constitution.

10.title: Dave
10.author: by David Miller.
notes: Summary: Dave has dental floss stuck between his teeth.

11.title: Dave

notes: Summary: Dave declares his love for Darla, but has technical difficulties.

12.title: Dave
12.author: David Miller.
12.series: Aug. 16, 1993) "I Don't Know Whether to Delegate Authority or to Question It!"*
notes: Summary: Dave tells Stretch to file something, then changes his mind.

13.title: Dave
13.author: by David Miller.
13.series: Sept. 10, 1993) "All I Ask of You, the Passenger, is that You Control Yourself!"*
notes: Summary: She's driving, and has things under control.

14.title: Dave
14.author: David Miller.
notes: Summary: Dave is shopping for a bicycle, and sees the shock absorbers and the price.

15.title: Dave
15.author: David Miller.
15.series: Aug. 26, 1995) "Dad, Is There a Correct Time to Get Married?"*
notes: Summary: Dad puts it between taking up golf and learning to like jazz.

22.title: Dave
22.author: Dave Miller.
22.series: May 25, 1998) "What About Me? I'm from Jersey!"*

23.title: Dave
23.author: Dave Miller.
23.series: July 25, 1998) "I Thought You Might Like to Listen to the Radio While You Lie Here"*
notes: Summary: Dave as gone as far as he can on the bike ride; his partner gives him the car keys since he's still right by the car.

80.heading: Davenport, Homer, 1867-1912--Miscellanea.
80.title: "A Cartoon Odyssey : The National Gallery of Caricature & Cartoon Art"
80.author: by Art Wood
notes: Summary: Describes the opening of the new gallery in Washington, D.C. Includes illustrations by David Low, Richard Outcault, George Herriman, Zim, Arthur Szyk, Davenport, Thomas Nast, and James Montgomery Flagg. Photographs of Art Wood, Kim Gibson, Tom Gibson, Dick Locher, Mike Kilian, Pat Oliphant, Bunny Hoest, Bill Rechin, Susan Conway, Lynne Wood, Nancy McClellan, Jack McLeod, Dick Sackett, John Stampone, Mark Mathes, Peter Steiner, and Bud Grace.
